channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Collecting scrap metal, 4th June
item.description:
Hi,we have a guy going round are area in a white van collecting scrap,but he is going up people's driveways looking for stuff which us & our neighbours are not happy about.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Liddington Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges need cutting, 3rd June
item.description:
Last reported 18th May and still not done. Yet the grass has been cut a couple of times, which wasn't really needed!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Willowleaze, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 60 Saint Paul's Street North, Cheltenham

item.title: Car parked on double yellow lines and totally blocking pavement, 1st June
item.description:
No pedestrian access to pavement, impossible for parents with buggies or wheelchair users. Further down Great Norwood street is another car parked on the pavement. It is about time this problem is addressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Great Norwood Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges blocking roundabout, 1st June
item.description:
When entering the roundabout (if coming from Tesco direction and going straight over the roundabout as an example) your view is completely blocked when entering the roundabout by car due to the height of the hedges and how close they are to the roundabout. You can't see oncoming cars It's really dangerous and the hedges need cutting lower asap. This roundabout seems to be where it is the worst but there are some hedges on the other roundabouts that could do with being trimmer lower too
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Delta Way, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously overgrown grass, 31st May
item.description:
When approaching the round about (from Barnwood heading towards Brockworth) you view is completely blocked by the overgrown grass Really dangerous and needs cutting ASAP See attached picture

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip at Entrance to Old Quarry off Cleeve Common Road, 31st May
item.description:
The location is once agin the Entrance to the Old Quarry off the Cleeve Common Road. Consiting of polystyrene, cardboard and electic wiring, please can this area be cleared up as sonn as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip at the Location, 31st May
item.description:
The location is close to the Burnt Oak Crossroads on the Aggs Hill / Cotswold Way road going towards Whittington. The tip consists of a mattress adn rubbish in a Tesco Bag which has spilled out. To stop it blowing away - the rubbish was pushed together and out of the road. Please can it be cleared up as sonn as possible. Please also note and refer to the separate email and conversation with Cheltenham Environmental Health Dept

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large piece of plastic on the corner PE way blown off a building during the high winds it’s been there over a month, 31st May
item.description:
Large piece of plastic on the corner PEY blown off a building during the high winds it’s been there over a month tucked in behind the telephone box. Can somebody please come and pick it up

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Tyler Court, Cheltenham

item.title: Water leak, 29th May
item.description:
Water leaking from small square metal plate in road - running straight into adjacent road gully. Lansdown Crescent, a few metres from it's junction with the A40 Lansdown Road - opposite Westal Green filling station. Been leaking constantly for weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Westal Stores Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
